item.title: What Really Goes on in a Computer
item.description: I wanted to start a series of posts on how the Linux operating system works, partially inspired by linux-insides, but instead of covering the entire operating system which is way too much work for my lazy ass, I’ll just focus on several aspects of the OS which I find interesting and may have taken me more time to grasp compared to other things. My motivation for doing this is mainly to learn more about Linux.

item.title: PostgreSQL Query Optimization
item.description: The other day I saw a tweet about blog posts it would be great to see, and one of them was “inside PostgreSQL: how a join works internally, what makes it fast”. Coincidentally, I’m taking a course on database system implementation, and I thought this would be a great way to study for my midterm! Of course, by the time I’ve finished this post, the midterm is long gone, but it was still a great incentive for me to start writing :)

item.title: Why This Blog
item.description: I originally started this blog as a graduate student while I was at Columbia, in the hopes of putting my spare time to better use than playing video games. Now I just use it as a reason for me to do some research into things I never dedicate enough time to understand, and hopefully benefit whoever stumbles upon it. Also in case you’re wondering, it’s unbelievably easy to spin up something like this.
